2020-21 SCHOOL YEAR
POLICY FOR PROVIDING FREE MEALS FOR SCHOOL DIVISIONS PARTICIPATING IN THE COMMUNITY ELIGIBILITY PROVISION (CEP) FOR ALL SCHOOLS IN THE DIVISION (Division wide)

Today Pulaski County Public Schools announced its policy for providing free meals to all children served under the National School Lunch and School Breakfast Programs. Each school and/or central school nutrition office has a copy of the policy, which may be reviewed by any interested party.

All schools in the division will be participating in the Community Eligibility Provision (CEP) as implemented under the Healthy, Hunger-Free Kids Act of 2010. Enrolled students will be provided a nutritious meal for breakfast and lunch each day at no charge to the household. Households will not be required to submit a meal application form to receive meals at no charge.
Any questions can be directed to:

Name: Ethelene Sadler
Title: Director, School Nutrition
Address: 202 N. Washington Avenue Pulaski, VA 24301
Phone: 540-994-2523
E-mail: esadler@pcva.us

Effective July 1, 2019, a booster dose of Tdap vaccine is required for all children entering the 7th grade.

The booster Tdap vaccine may be received from your Health Care Provider or the Local Health Department. The health department gives the booster shot by appointment only. The Montgomery County Health Department (540-585-3300) will offer appointments starting June 15, 2020. Pulaski County Health Department (540-440-2188) will offer appointments every 4th Thursday starting on June 25, 2020.

Your child will not be allowed to start 7th grade until the school has written documentation that the required Tdap vaccine has been received. I encourage parents to make an appointment to get your child’s Tdap shot completed as soon as possible. Please bring written documentation from your health care provider to your child’s school nurse so their health record can be updated.

If you have questions, you may call Mary Hall, Supervisor of Health Services at 643-0531 or your child’s school nurse.

Thank you for your cooperation.

post_text: Pulaski County Public Schools has cancelled the public school board meeting that was scheduled to take place on Wednesday, March 4, 2020. The purpose of this meeting was to present information and receive stakeholder feedback about the possibility of going to a 4-day per week school calendar. After reviewing the preliminary research, it was determined that additional time would be needed to develop a viable 4-day school week proposal. The Pulaski County School Board will reassess this issue in the fall of 2020 and the public meeting will be rescheduled at that time if the Board decides to move forward. Thank you to everyone who gave their time to complete the employee and community surveys. We genuinely appreciate the dialogue that has developed around the need for Pulaski County to explore innovative incentives for attracting teachers to our school division and helping us to retain the excellent teachers who are already here.

Pulaski County Public Schools recently conducted a survey of teachers regarding student cell phone use in the middle and high schools. The results of this survey indicate that cell phones are used less than 3 times per week on average for educational purposes, each teacher is responding to student misuse of cell phones an average of 29 times per week, and 2/3 of our secondary teachers feel that cell phones are having a negative impact on the classroom environment.

The Pulaski County Public Schools school board members, teachers, administrators, and other stakeholders will be working together in the coming months to determine if changes need to be made to our policies and practices regarding student cell phone use the classroom. Additional information will be provided as we work through the process of ensuring that each PCPS student has a positive and meaningful educational experience.

Pulaski Middle School has chosen Ms. Karen Brown as our staff member of the month. Ms. Brown has been the PMS bookkeeper for 16 years. Prior to that she was in bookkeeping at the central office level since 1992. She is efficient and thorough in her job and makes sure that policies and procedures are followed so that the school runs smoothly from a financial standpoint.

Some of the comments included with her nomination include:

Mrs. Brown always helps complete purchase orders for supplies while handling finances as well as many other issues including copier problems. She always says “Hi” and keeps a smile on her face.

Karen does a fantastic job as a bookkeeper. She is an incredible work ethic and is always ready to help in whatever way possible.

This past week Ms. Brown performed her duties as well as taking care of the front office due to Mrs. Golden needing time off to be with her family. Ms. Brown did a great job and the school never missed a beat.

We are excited to celebrate with her on her selection as Employee of the Month.

post_text: Pulaski County Public Schools is happy to announce that Mr. Adam Joyce has been hired to be the first principal for Pulaski County Middle School. Mr. Joyce has been the principal of Dublin Middle School for the past five years and will serve as the principal of Pulaski Middle School for the 2019-2020 school year which will provide him the opportunity to establish a working relationship with faculty and staff members from both schools prior to the opening of PCMS. We are very excited to have Mr. Joyce help lead this process and look forward to an exciting and productive 2019-2020 school year.

post_text: Part of Pulaski Elementary’s success comes from dedicated volunteers like Mr. John Burger. Mr. Burger serves as a math tutor for both remediation and gifted students on a daily basis. He started with us as a volunteer in our Connections Mentoring program coordinated by Christine Bailey a few years ago. In that program he worked with students one on one with reading remediation. Five years ago he joined our after school STEM Club as a volunteer and has run the after school STEM Club since the fall of 2015. Mr. Burger began his career in the Navy and retired as a Navy Oceanographer. His strengths are in math, computer science and oceanography. He loves sharing his love for the ocean with students whenever possible and this year he runs the Oceanography Club on Club Days at PES. It is evident that Mr. Burger enjoys working with students, and he was wants to see them succeed and to inspire them to consider a future career in the STEM fields. I am especially appreciative of him joining our STEM Club and making my dream come true for our school.
